sen.j: 河野 通信（こうの みちのぶ、保元元年（1156年） - 貞応元年（1223年）5月19日）は平安時代末期から鎌倉時代初期にかけての伊予国の武将。
sen.e: Michinobu KONO (1156 - July 6, 1222 (表記の変更) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in Iyo Province, who lived during the end of Heian period to the early Kamakura period.
Michinobu KONO (1156 - July 6, 1222 was a Japanese military commander in Iyo Province who lived from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 貞応元年（1223年）5月19日→July 6, 1222（（表記の変更）は不要なので削除しました。）武将→a Japanese military commander平安時代末期から鎌倉時代初期にかけて→from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period（用語集に従って変更しました。）"who"の前のカンマは特に必要ないので削除しました。
sen.e: Michinobu KONO (1156 - July 6, 1222 was a Japanese military commander in Iyo Province who lived from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 河野通清の子。
sen.e: He was the son of Michikiyo KONO.
He was the son of Michikiyo KONO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was the son of Michikiyo KONO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 通称は四郎。
sen.e: His common name was Shiro.
He was commonly called Shiro.
sen.cmt: 通称→be commonly called（用語集に従って変更しました。）
sen.e: He was commonly called Shiro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 伊予水軍の将。
sen.e: He was the commander of the Iyo navy.
He was a commander of the Iyo navy.
sen.cmt: 将→a commander（初出であり、一般的な将をさしているので、冠詞を"the"から"a"に変更しました。）
sen.e: He was a commander of the Iyo navy.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 子に通政、河野通久。
sen.e: Michimasa and Michihisa KONO were his sons.
His children were Michimasa and Michihisa KONO.
sen.cmt: 「河野通信」に関する項目なので、「河野通信の子」"his children"を主語にしました。
sen.e: His children were Michimasa and Michihisa KONO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 出家して観光と号した。
sen.e: He went into priesthood and named himself Kanko.
When entering into priesthood, he was given the name Kanko as his go (byname).
sen.cmt: 出家する→enter inter priesthood（用語集に従って変更しました。）～と号する→be given the name ～ as one's go（用語集に従って変更しました。）
sen.e: When entering into priesthood, he was given the name Kanko as his go (byname).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一遍の祖父にあたる。
sen.e: He was the grandfather of Ippen.
His grandson was Ippen.
sen.cmt: 「一遍の祖父にあたる」は、言い換えると「一遍は孫にあたる」となるので、上記「子に通政、河野通久。」の英訳と同様に、"His ～"としました。
sen.e: His grandson was Ippen.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）8月に源頼朝が反平氏の兵を挙げると、それに呼応し治承5年（1181年）に父通清と共に本拠の伊予国風早郡高縄山城（愛媛県北条市）に拠って平維盛の目代を追放した。
sen.e: In September 1180 (表記の変更), when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo rose an anti-Heishi (anti-Taira clan) army, he and his father Michikiyo set out from their headquarter castle, Takanawayama-jo Castle in Kazahaya Country, Iyo Province (present Hojo City, Ehime Prefecture) to respond to Yoritomo's rising, and expel the mokudai (deputy kokushi, or a deputy provincial governor) of TAIRA no Koremori at the headquarters.

When MINAMOTO no Yoritomo rose an anti-Heishi (anti-Taira clan) army in September 1180, he and his father, Michikiyo, locked themselves in the headquarter castle, Takanawayama-jo Castle in Kazahaya County, Iyo Province (located in present-day Hojo City, Ehime Prefecture), in concert with such rising and expelled mokudai (deputy kokushi, or a deputy provincial governor) of TAIRA no Koremori in 1181.
sen.cmt: 治承4年（1180年）8月に→in September 1180（（表記の変更）は不要なので削除しました。）呼応し→in concert with（「それに合わせて」という意味なので変更しました。）治承5年（1181年）に→in 1181（訳抜けしていたので補いました。）父通清→his father, Michikiyo,（前後にカンマを挿入しました。）郡→County（ミススペルを訂正しました。）拠って→lock oneself in（「引きこもる」という意味なので変更しました。）
sen.e: When MINAMOTO no Yoritomo rose an anti-Heishi (anti-Taira clan) army in September 1180, he and his father, Michikiyo, locked themselves in the headquarter castle, Takanawayama-jo Castle in Kazahaya County, Iyo Province (located in present-day Hojo City, Ehime Prefecture), in concert with such rising and expelled mokudai (deputy kokushi, or a deputy provincial governor) of TAIRA no Koremori in 1181.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし伊予内外の平氏方の総攻撃を受け、父通清は同城で討ち死にした。
sen.e: However, they suffered a full-scale attack from the Taira clan from within and without Iyo Province, and his father Michikiyo died in battle at the castle.
However, they suffered all-out assaults from Taira clan armies within and without Iyo Province, and his father, Michikiyo, died in battle at such Castle.
sen.cmt: 総攻撃→all-out attack（用語集に従って変更しました。）同城→the Castle（高縄山城 （Takanawayama-jo Castle）を指すので、大文字表記に変更しました。）
sen.e: However, they suffered all-out assaults from Taira clan armies within and without Iyo Province, and his father, Michikiyo, died in battle at such Castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後通信は高縄半島でゲリラ戦を展開し、進入していた備後国の西寂を倒し、阿波国の田口成直を伊予国喜多郡比志城（大洲市）で撃破して主導権を握った。
sen.e: After that, Michinobu started guerilla warfare in Takanawa Peninsula, and defeated Seijaku of Bingo Province, who was intruding into the area, and smashed Masanao TAGUCHI of Awa Province at the Hishi-jo Castle in Kita Country, Iyo Province (Ozu City) to grip the initiative.

After that, Michinobu waged guerrilla warfare in the Takanawa Peninsula, and after defeating Seijaku of Bingo Province who was intruding into the area, he defeated Masanao TAGUCHI of Awa Province at the Hishi-jo Castle in Kita County, Iyo Province (located in present-day Ozu City), and gained the initiative.
sen.cmt: 高縄半島→the Takanawa Peninsula（定冠詞を付けました。）ゲリラ戦を展開する→wage guerrila warfare（「展開する」には"wage"を使用し、"guerilla"を"guerrilla"（用語集に表記されているスペルに）変更しました。）郡→Country（ミススペルを訂正しました。）撃破する→defeat（用語集に従って変更しました。）（大洲市）→located in present-day Ozu City（用語集に従って変更しました。）主導権を握る→gain the initiative（"grip"では「握る」の意味が異なるので、"gain"に変更しました。）
sen.e: After that, Michinobu waged guerrilla warfare in the Takanawa Peninsula, and after defeating Seijaku of Bingo Province who was intruding into the area, he defeated Masanao TAGUCHI of Awa Province at the Hishi-jo Castle in Kita County, Iyo Province (located in present-day Ozu City), and gained the initiative.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文治元年（1185年）2月、源義経が平氏追討のため四国へ下ってくると、通信は軍船を率いて屋島へ赴き、志度合戦で義経に軍船を献上した。
sen.e: In March 1185 (表記の変更), when MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune came down to Shikoku region to search and kill Heishi (the Taira clan), Michinobu directed toward Yashima Peninsula, leading a warship and offered the ship to Yoshitsune to use it in the Battle of Shido.

In March 1185, when MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune came down to the Shikoku region to search and kill Heishi (the Taira clan), Michinobu proceeded to the Yashima Peninsula with leading a warship and presented the ship to Yoshitsune in the Battle of Shido.
sen.cmt: 文治元年（1185年）2月→In March 1185（（表記の変更）の語句は不要なので削除しました。）～へ赴く→proceed to（"direct"は他動詞なので、変更しました。）献上する→present（用語集に従って変更しました。）
sen.e: In March 1185, when MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune came down to the Shikoku region to search and kill Heishi (the Taira clan), Michinobu proceeded to the Yashima Peninsula with leading a warship and presented the ship to Yoshitsune in the Battle of Shido.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 壇ノ浦の戦いにも参加し、通信の軍船が中堅となって活躍した。
sen.e: He also took part in the Battle of Dannoura, the warship lead by Michinobu rendered distinguished service as a main force.
He also took part in the Battle of Dannoura, and the warship lead by Michinobu rendered distinguished service as a main force.
sen.cmt: 接続詞"and"を挿入しました。
sen.e: He also took part in the Battle of Dannoura, and the warship lead by Michinobu rendered distinguished service as a main force.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 戦後は鎌倉幕府の御家人となり、守護職は与えられなかったものの、伊予国内の一部の御家人を統括する強い権限を認められた。
sen.e: In the postwar period, he became gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods)of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and although he was not assigned to the position of shugoshiki (provincial military governor), he was allowed to enjoy a strong authority to supervise the gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate) in a part of Iyo Province.

In the postwar period, he became gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods)of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and although he was not assigned to shugoshiki (post of provincial constable), he was granted a strong authority to supervise some gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate) in Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 伊予国内の一部の御家人→some gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate) in Iyo Province（「一部」は伊予国内」ではなく「御家人」に掛かるので、変更しました。）守護職→post of provincial constable（用語集に従って変更しました。）権限を認められた→granted（「権限を与えられた」という意味なので変更しました。）
sen.e: In the postwar period, he became gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods)of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and although he was not assigned to shugoshiki (post of provincial constable), he was granted a strong authority to supervise some gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate) in Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文治5年（1189年）の奥州合戦に従軍。
sen.e: In 1189, he took a part in the campaign of Battle of Oshu.
In 1189, he campaigned in the Battle of Oshu.
sen.cmt: 従軍→campaign（「従軍する」にあたる動詞"campaign"に変更しました。）
sen.e: In 1189, he campaigned in the Battle of Oshu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 子の通政は西面武士として院庁に仕えた。
sen.e: His son Michimasa served In no cho (Retired Emperor's Office) as Saimen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the west side).
His son, Michimasa, served in In no cho (Retired Emperor's Office) as Saimen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the west side).
sen.cmt: 子の通政→His son, Michimasa,（前後にカンマを挿入しました。）仕える→serve in（人ではなく、『院庁』という部署に仕えるので、変更しました。）
sen.e: His son, Michimasa, served in In no cho (Retired Emperor's Office) as Saimen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the west side).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 通信は承久3年（1221年）の承久の乱で後鳥羽天皇方につくが、上皇方が敗北すると通政と共に領地へ戻り、高縄山城に籠もって反抗を続けた。
sen.e: In 1221 when the Jokyu War broke out, he supported the Retired Emperor Gotoba's side, however, the Retired Emperor's side was defeated, he returned to his territory with Michimasa, and continued resistance, confined themselves in the castle.
sen.cmt: 後鳥羽天皇→Retired Emperor Gotobaとしました（同一文中に「上皇方」と出てくるので）。上皇方→Retired Emperor side領地→territory
sen.e: Although he took the Retired Emperor Gotoba's side in the Jokyu War in 1221, Michinobu returned to his territory with Michimasa when the Retired Emperor side was defeated, and they continued resistance by confining themselves in Takanawayama-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: （つく）が、→Although（用語リストに従い"although"で始まる文章に変更しました。）～方につく→take the ～'s side（用語集に従って変更しました。）高縄山城→Takanawajo-Castle（「高縄山城」と明記されているので、変更しました。）
sen.e: Although he took the Retired Emperor Gotoba's side in the Jokyu War in 1221, Michinobu returned to his territory with Michimasa when the Retired Emperor side was defeated, and they continued resistance by confining themselves in Takanawayama-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし翌年に幕府方に居城を攻められ降伏。
sen.e: However, the next year, their castle was attacked by the bakufu side and surrendered.
sen.cmt: 居城→castle
sen.e: However, they surrendered due to an attack on his residential castle by the Shogunate side in the following year.
sen.cmt: 幕府方→the Shogunate side（用語集に従って変更しました。）居城→residential castle（用語集に従って変更しました。）
sen.e: However, they surrendered due to an attack on his residential castle by the Shogunate side in the following year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 捕虜となって陸奥国江刺に流罪となり、通政は斬られ、所領の多くは没収された。
sen.e: They became captives and he was banished to Esashi Country, Mutsu Province, while Michimasa was slashed to death, and many of the territories were forfeited.
sen.cmt: 捕虜→captive陸奥国→Mutsu Province流罪→be banished斬られ→be slashed to death所領→territory没収された→forfeited
sen.e: After they captured, Michinobu was exiled to Esashi County, Mutsu Province, and Michimasa was slashed to death, and then, many of the territories were forfeited.
sen.cmt: 捕虜となる→capture～に流罪となる→exiled to ～（用語集に従って変更しました。）
sen.e: After they captured, Michinobu was exiled to Esashi County, Mutsu Province, and Michimasa was slashed to death, and then, many of the territories were forfeited.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 江刺郡稲瀬（現在の岩手県北上市稲瀬町）にある国見山極楽寺で貞応元年（1223年）に死去した。
sen.e: He died in 1223 at Kunimisan Mountain Gokuraku-ji Temple located in Inase, Esashi Country (present Inase-cho, Kitakami-gun Iwate Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 江刺郡稲瀬→Inase, Esashi Country岩手県北上市→Kitakami City Iwate Prefecture国見山→Kunimisan Mountain極楽寺→Gokuraku-ji Temple
sen.e: Michinobu died in 1222 at Gokuraku-ji Temple of Mt. Kunimi located in Inase, Esashi County (present-day Inase-cho, Kitakami City, Iwate Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 郡→County（ミススペルを訂正しました。）北上市→Kitakami City（誤記を訂正しました。）国見山→Mt. Kunimi（用語集に従って変更しました。）貞応元年（1223年）に死去した→died in 1222（上記の没年に従い、"in 1222"としました。）
sen.e: Michinobu died in 1222 at Gokuraku-ji Temple of Mt. Kunimi located in Inase, Esashi County (present-day Inase-cho, Kitakami City, Iwate Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 享年68。
sen.e: He was 68 years old.
He died at the age of 68.
sen.cmt: 享年→died at the age of（用語集に従って変更しました。）
sen.e: He died at the age of 68.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大正5年（1916年）贈従五位。
sen.e: In 1916, he was posthumously conferred Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
sen.cmt: 贈→posthumously conferredとしました。従五位→Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank)
sen.e: In 1916, he was posthumously awarded the rank of Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
sen.cmt: 贈従五位→be awarded the rank of Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank)
sen.e: In 1916, he was posthumously awarded the rank of Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 墓所は現在も稲瀬町水越地区に聖塚として残る。
sen.e: His graveyard called Hijiri-zuka (mound) still remains in the area of Mizukoshi in Inase-cho (Kitakami City, Iwate Prefecture).
His graveyard still remains as Hijiri-zuka (mound) in the area of Mizukoshi in Inase-cho (Kitakami City, Iwate Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「～として」を表記するため、"as "を用いました。
sen.e: His graveyard still remains as Hijiri-zuka (mound) in the area of Mizukoshi in Inase-cho (Kitakami City, Iwate Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 孫にあたる一遍が全国を遊行した様子を描いた絵巻物である「一遍上人絵伝」に、弘安3年（1280年）に祖父の墓で供養を行う様子が描かれていることが、この墓所を発見する手がかりになった。
sen.e: The graveyard was found thanks to the illustration of 'Ippen shonin eden' (Illustrated Biography of the Monk Ippen), the picture scroll depicting his grandson Ippen's travel all over Japan, in which Ippan was celebrating the memorial service in 1280 for the his dead grandfather.

This graveyard was found out from an illustration showing that Michinobu's grandson, Ippen, held the memorial service at his grandfather's grave in 1280 which was contained in 'Ippen shonin eden' (Illustrated Biography of the Monk Ippen), a picture scroll showing Ippen's travel all over Japan.
sen.cmt: 「祖父の墓で供養を行う」を "Ippan was celebrating the memorial service in 1280 for the his dead grandfather"と英訳されておりますが、意味が一致しないので、変更しました。
sen.e: This graveyard was found out from an illustration showing that Michinobu's grandson, Ippen, held the memorial service at his grandfather's grave in 1280 which was contained in 'Ippen shonin eden' (Illustrated Biography of the Monk Ippen), a picture scroll showing Ippen's travel all over Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 河野氏本家はひとり鎌倉幕府方に付いた子の河野通久によって辛うじて続くこととなったが、以後伊予国内での影響力が低下することとなった。
sen.e: The head family of the Kono clan was succeeded by his son Michihisa KONO, who alone supported the Kamakura bakufu side, and managed to persist, however, since Michinobu's banishment, the family's influence in Iyo Province had been reduced.
sen.cmt: 以後→since Michinobu's banishmentとしました。
sen.e: Although the head family of the Kono clan barely survived due to succession by his son, Michihisa KONO, who solely took the side of Kamakura bakufu, its influence in Iyo Province weakened afterwards.
sen.cmt: （なった）が、→Although（用語リストに従い、"although"で始まる文章に変更しました。）辛うじて続く→barely survive（「辛うじて」とあるので、"survive"の方がその存続の危うさを表現していると思い、変更しました。）以後→afterwards（単に「以後」を表す単語に変更しました。）低下する→weaken（「影響力が弱まる」の意味なので、変更しました。）
sen.e: Although the head family of the Kono clan barely survived due to succession by his son, Michihisa KONO, who solely took the side of Kamakura bakufu, its influence in Iyo Province weakened afterwards.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
